Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXFormMapping

  • @Repeatable(AFXFormMappings.class)
@Target(FIELD)
@Retention(RUNTIME)
public @interface AFXFormMapping
    Repeatable annotation that can be applied at field level on a ObjectProperty additionally to a AFXFormBinding annotation to explicitly map a field in a model class to a control name.

    Please note: Using this annotation on a field without a AFXFormBinding annotation will have no effect.

    Author:
    koster

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element Description
      java.lang.String controlId
      The ID of the control that shall be mapped to the field name in the model class.
      java.lang.String propertyName
      The name of the field inside the model class.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      BooleanValue expectedBoolean
      Set his attribute to BooleanValue.TRUE, if the value of the referenced control holds a boolean value that is mandatory to be true, or set it to BooleanValue.FALSE, if the value of the control has to be false.
      java.lang.String formatPattern
      An optional format pattern that is used to format.
      boolean future
      Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the future.
      boolean futureOrPresent
      Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the future or present.
      long maxSize
      The maximum size that the control needs to have to pass validation (string length in case of string based controls, list size in case of list based controls).
      double maxVal
      The maximum value that the control needs to have to pass validation (in case of string based controls the string is converted into a number and then validated against this attribute value).
      long minSize
      The minimum size that the control needs to have to pass validation (string length in case of string based controls, list size in case of list based controls).
      double minVal
      The minimum value that the control needs to have to pass validation (in case of string based controls the string is converted into a number and then validated against this attribute value).
      boolean past
      Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the past.
      boolean pastOrPresent
      Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the past or present.
      java.lang.String regExp
      The regular expression that a contol's value needs to match for passing validation.
      boolean required
      Indicates whether the referenced control is mandatory to be filled out.
      ControlProperties targetProperty
      The control's target property that shall be used as binding target.
      java.lang.String validationMessage
      Validation error message to be displayed, in case the control failed validation.
      java.lang.String validationMessageKey
      Properties key to a validation error message to be displayed, in case the control failed validation.
      java.lang.String validationMethod
      The custom validation method inside the ActionFX controller to be invoked for the annotated control's value.
      ValidationMode validationMode
      Defines, when the actual validation is performed.
      int validationStartTimeoutMs
      Defines the timeout in milliseconds that has to pass after changing a control value, before the actual validation is applied to.

    • Element Detail

      • propertyName

        java.lang.String propertyName
        The name of the field inside the model class. The value can be also a nested path using the "." notation for Java beans.
        Returns:
        the name of the field inside the model class.

      • controlId

        java.lang.String controlId
        The ID of the control that shall be mapped to the field name in the model class.
        Returns:
        the control ID

      • targetProperty

        ControlProperties targetProperty
        The control's target property that shall be used as binding target. Default is the user value of the control (ControlProperties.USER_VALUE_OBSERVABLE).
        Returns:
        the target property description of the control's binding target
        Default:
        com.github.actionfx.core.view.graph.ControlProperties.USER_VALUE_OBSERVABLE

      • formatPattern

        java.lang.String formatPattern
        An optional format pattern that is used to format.

        This parameter can be used e.g to convert floating point numbers to/from string with a specific pattern or to convert Java java.time datetime types to/from string.

        Returns:
        the format pattern.
        Default:
        ""

      • validationMethod

        java.lang.String validationMethod
        The custom validation method inside the ActionFX controller to be invoked for the annotated control's value.

        Referenced methods can be of the following signatures:

        For controls with a single-value:

        • ValidationResult methodName()
        • ValidationResult methodName(TYPE newValue)

        For controls with multi-values:

        • ValidationResult methodName()
        • ValidationResult methodName(ObservableList<TYPE> selectedValue)
        Alternatively to the method signatures above that return a ValidationResult, it is also possible invoke void-methods. In that case, developer need to handle the display of validation messages themselves in the validation method.

        • void methodName()
        Returns:
        the method name inside the ActionFX controller
        Default:
        ""

      • required

        boolean required
        Indicates whether the referenced control is mandatory to be filled out.
        Returns:
        true, if the annotated control needs to have a user value, false otherwise. Default is false.
        Default:
        false

      • minVal

        double minVal
        The minimum value that the control needs to have to pass validation (in case of string based controls the string is converted into a number and then validated against this attribute value). If there is no value specified for this attribute, no minimum validation is applied.
        Returns:
        the minimum value. Default is Double.MIN_VALUE (which means, "no minimum specified").
        Default:
        4.9E-324

      • maxVal

        double maxVal
        The maximum value that the control needs to have to pass validation (in case of string based controls the string is converted into a number and then validated against this attribute value). If there is no value specified for this attribute, no maximum validation is applied.
        Returns:
        the maximum value. Default is Double.MAX_VALUE (which means, "no maximum specified").
        Default:
        1.7976931348623157E308

      • minSize

        long minSize
        The minimum size that the control needs to have to pass validation (string length in case of string based controls, list size in case of list based controls). If there is no value specified for this attribute, no minimum size validation is applied.
        Returns:
        the minimum value. Default is Long.MIN_VALUE (which means, "no minimum specified").
        Default:
        -9223372036854775808L

      • maxSize

        long maxSize
        The maximum size that the control needs to have to pass validation (string length in case of string based controls, list size in case of list based controls). If there is no value specified for this attribute, no maximum size validation is applied.
        Returns:
        the maximum value. Default is Long.MAX_VALUE (which means, "no maximum specified").
        Default:
        9223372036854775807L

      • regExp

        java.lang.String regExp
        The regular expression that a contol's value needs to match for passing validation.
        Returns:
        the regular expression that needs to match
        Default:
        ""

      • past

        boolean past
        Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the past.
        Returns:
        true, if the value of the control must be in the past. Default is false.
        Default:
        false

      • pastOrPresent

        boolean pastOrPresent
        Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the past or present.
        Returns:
        true, if the value of the control must be in the past or present. Default is false.
        Default:
        false

      • future

        boolean future
        Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the future.
        Returns:
        true, if the value of the control must be in the future. Default is false.
        Default:
        false

      • futureOrPresent

        boolean futureOrPresent
        Set this attribute to true, if the value of the referenced control needs to hold a temporal value in the future or present.
        Returns:
        true, if the value of the control must be in the future or present. Default is false.
        Default:
        false

      • expectedBoolean

        BooleanValue expectedBoolean
        Set his attribute to BooleanValue.TRUE, if the value of the referenced control holds a boolean value that is mandatory to be true, or set it to BooleanValue.FALSE, if the value of the control has to be false.
        Returns:
        BooleanValue.TRUE, if the boolean value of the referenced control must be true, or set it to BooleanValue.FALSE, if it must be false. Default is BooleanValue.UNDEFINED, which means there is no validation on the control's boolean value.
        Default:
        com.github.actionfx.core.annotation.BooleanValue.UNDEFINED

      • validationMessage

        java.lang.String validationMessage
        Validation error message to be displayed, in case the control failed validation.
        Returns:
        the validation error message
        Default:
        ""

      • validationMessageKey

        java.lang.String validationMessageKey
        Properties key to a validation error message to be displayed, in case the control failed validation. A value in this attribute has a higher priority than the value specified in validationMessage().
        Returns:
        the properties key to the validation error message
        Default:
        ""

      • validationStartTimeoutMs

        int validationStartTimeoutMs
        Defines the timeout in milliseconds that has to pass after changing a control value, before the actual validation is applied to.

        This value is only used, if validation mode ValidationMode.ONCHANGE is supplied in attribute validationMode().

        Returns:
        the timeout value in milliseconds. Default is -1.
        Default:
        -1

      • validationMode

        ValidationMode validationMode
        Defines, when the actual validation is performed.

        Possible options are:

        • ValidationMode.ONCHANGE: Validation is applied, when a change occurs in a control that holds any validation annotation.
        • ValidationMode.MANUAL: Validation occurs only, when an explicit call to ActionFX.validate(Object) is performed.
        *
        Returns:
        the validation mode. Default is ValidationMode.ONCHANGE.
        Default:
        com.github.actionfx.core.annotation.ValidationMode.ONCHANGE
